page.title: 01Lowhills Nthwest of Ludlow
page.content: The main feature is the low rolling flat limestone ridge with a Western slope facing the River Clum and a dip slope draining into the River Onny. The scarp is indented and the dip slope has few deep, steepsided valleys often wooded cutting into it. These are used, at valley shoulder level by lines to the valley head, the valleys being too steep and deep to cross. Population is sparse, one hamlet, perhaps 10 farms, a short string of bungalows and occasional cottage There is intensive farming, one farm which had 30 acres of rough land a few years ago has no rough grazing now, but 8 acres of woodland, also 140 acres of winter barley and 40 acres of oats. On steep slopes the full advantge of our wheel drive extra width wheels for tractors, etc. are being used. Friesian/Hereford
